en: A youth, perhaps Eubouleus, standing near frontal, with his head profile to the right, wearing a long-sleeved, short, oriental tunic, a red taenia, and tall boots, raises his right hand at his side; his left hand is obscured by Dionysos, standing near frontal, with his weight on his left leg, his head turned profile to the right, wearing a long-sleeved, long, oriental tunic, a himation around his waist and over his left shoulder, obscuring his left hand, a nebris tied over his left shoulder, and a red ivy wreath, rests the back of his left hand on his hip, and holds a gold thyrsos in his lowered right hand; white Demeter, seated 3/4-view to the left on a blue cista, with her head turned 3/4-view to the right, wearing a colored peplos, a gold relief polos crown, a gold beaded necklace, two-part pendant earrings (in relief), a gold band on each wrist, rests his right hand on his knee, and holds a gold scepter in his upraised left; a young, white boy, Ploutos, standing near frontal, with his weight on his left leg, and his head turned profile to the left, wearing a blue chlamys on his back tied with red cross-straps, a short pony tail, and a gold taenia, rests his right elbow on a cista, and cradles in his left arm a keras; white Kore, standing near frontal, slightly to the right, with her head turned 3/4-view to the left, wearing a button-sleeved chiton, a himation, a laurel wreath, a gold band on her right wrist, a gold beaded necklace, and two-part pendant earrings, holds two torches, one in each hand, to the left; a female figure, Eleusis (or Rhea ?), seated profile to the left on an omphalos (otherwise interpreted as "the Mirthless rock"), wearing a himation veiled over her head and around her body, obscuring her left arm and her hand, draped over a sleeveless chiton (?), a stephane, a gold beaded necklace, pendant earrings, and one band on her right wrist, rests her feet on a footstool; Eros seated 3/4-view to the right, with his head profile to the left, and his (blue?) wings frontal, wearing a himation around his lower legs and waist and a red taenia.

<bibl>LIMC</bibl>, 7.417 s.v. Ploutos no. 11 (K. Clinton), 631 s.v.
      Rhea no. 19, pl. 494 (F. Gury); <bibl>Clinton 1992</bibl>, 58, 75, 83-84, 93, 103,
      no. 8 figs. 22-23; <bibl>LIMC</bibl>, 4.57 s.v. Eumolpos 13 (L. Weidauer), 878
      s.v. Demeter no. 408, pl. 593 (L. Beschi); <bibl>Schwarz 1987</bibl>, 58 V 154;
      <bibl>LIMC</bibl>, 2.130 s.v. Aphrodite 1370 (A. Delivorrias); <bibl>Simon
      1983</bibl>, 27, pl. 9; <bibl>Loeb 1979, 233 n. 263</bibl>.
